div1.head: Remarks introducing Philip Showalter Hench to the Rotary Club [of Havana], [January 1952]
div1.p:
We are more than lucky, to have with us, Dr Philip Hench
, Chief of staff on Reumatology of Mayo Clinic on Rochester, Minnessota
together with his nice and pleasant wife.

It is not necessary to make clear before that Dr Hench is one of the
discoverers of the Cortisone, that wonderful drug that has revolutionize
many longings on Medicine and has offered to many patients much better
cures specially on the gronds of Arthritis.- For this great work Dr Henc
obtained las year Nobel Medicine Prize, and just on Thursday in
the morning he will received at the hands of Dr Andreu, the Condecora-
tion of Orden Finlay with an Official Rank.

You all know it has been treated on this very Rotary table, that
Dr Hench was at the same time the one, who rediscovered on Pogolotti
in the building Number 1, where the proof studies, were realized by the
American Comission headed by Dr Walter Reed that work of Finlay “it was
the mosquitoes the very agent to trasmiti the Yellow Fever”.
This Club has the honor to greet Dr Hench anf his wife today.
